meanings.definition: A member of a military class, originally composed of slaves, that seized control of the Egyptian sultanate in 1250 and ruled until 1517.
meanings.sent1: The mamelukes were skilled warriors who rose to power in Egypt.
meanings.sent2: During their rule, the mamelukes greatly influenced Egyptian history.
meanings.sent3: The mamelukes decided to have a race on their horses for fun.
meanings.sent4: The mamelukes' dominance was like a shadow over the sultanate.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mamelukes charging into battle is unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A member of a former military caste, originally composed of slaves, in India.
meanings.sent1: In ancient India, the mamelukes played a crucial role in battles.
meanings.sent2: The mamelukes' loyalty to their leaders was unwavering.
meanings.sent3: One mameluke accidentally tripped over his own sword during training.
meanings.sent4: The mamelukes stood tall like ancient guardians of the land.
meanings.sent5: The bravery of the mamelukes inspired legends among the people.
